name: Healthyfied Tinola Manok
description: Dive into a healthier version of a classic Filipino comfort food with this Healthyfied Tinola Manok. Brimming with high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar ingredients, it's a guilt-free delight for those seeking healthy yet hearty meals. Perfect for anyone looking to enjoy traditional flavors without compromising their dietary goals.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the thigh fillets under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice the red onion. Peel and julienne the ginger root. Peel and mince the garlic.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Season the thigh fillets with salt and ground pepper evenly on both sides.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, saut√© the sliced onion, julienned ginger, and minced garlic until they are soft and aromatic, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the seasoned thigh fillets to the pot and sear each side for about 3 minutes, allowing them to brown slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the pot with enough water to cover the chicken, then bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer until the chicken is fully cooked, about 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Optional: Add your choice of leafy greens or papaya slices 10 minutes before finishing the cooking to incorporate more nutrients.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
